rComments: Funny teaching style
Lousy prof! Does not teach, pushes his political agendas instead
Brilliant warm and caring prof

Wow the TAs are terrible. Did well on both tests(90s) and yet the TA gives a 65 on the essay that we worked really hard on. No feedback was also given. Ended up with a 75. Ridiculous. Not to mention what a horrible disorganized course it was.
Tests were easy but TAs will destroy your mark with that essay worth 50%
Excellent professor. Attendance is not mandatory, but can be helpful. If you do the textbook readings you will be well prepared. I highly recommend this course

His lectures are completely useless because it has nothing to do with the tests. You only need his books for the test. He is one of the worst lecturers. He makes the content sound so easy on his lectures, but his tests are actually super difficult. I did bad on the first test by studying his lecture, later I did excellent by studying only the book.

One of U of T's real gems. Danesi's practically an institution. Always finds ways to make classes more engaging, the course material is easy, and his sense of humor and wit are world renowned. A real honor and privilege being part of his classes.

Danesi is super nice and cares for his students, but often digresses in lecture. He teaches from the textbook (written by him). Though the content itself may seem easy, the TA marks everything and likes to test very specific details from the textbook. Evaluations included quizzes, an essay, and a final exam. Overall, an enjoyable class!

I had him for a first year seminar "Anthropology of Brands". He's a funny guy and a REALLY easy marker. He let us decide our essay topics and gave us free reign. His lectures were interesting, but sometimes they felt like they lacked substance - I don't regret the easy A though lol

he's a SUPER easy marker, and for papers he'll let you choose pretty much any topic as long as it's reasonably relevant to the course. tests are 100% based off the textbook, but i'd still attend lectures. he cuts them short a lot of the time and they're much more interesting than just the book, and he gets to know those who attend a lot.
Great professor, even greater guy. Passionate about what he does. Take Danesi's classes if you have the chance! I've had him for 3 years and have loved every one of his classes.
He is a really nice professor. His lectures are pretty interesting too! Loved this class and I will definitely miss it.
Inspiring prof! Though the course content is interesting in the first place

Danesi is one of the most memorable professors; he really stands out in this often cold institution. I got near perfect on both tests just from reading his book and writing notes on it. Although optional, I attended his class many times since he made them interesting. As a STEM student, this was my highest grade with least effort; definite bird.

Easy class. Don't need to attend lectures if you are willing to do the readings. Just did readings and studied the night before (got 80 on midterm and 82 on final). from the couple lectures i went to he lets you off 30-45 mins off early so thats a plus too

Course was easy for credit, but useless for knowledge. He even dismiss the lecture one hour earlier than the schedule. He repeatedly insulted president Donald Trump during his course, which is very unprofessional. He should kept his politcal beliefs to himself and treat the course seriously.

Nice guy, knows his stuff. Unfortunately, I think he's gotten a little too comfortable in his position. Course was extremely easy for someone in the anthropology or linguistics programme (most people take it as a byrd) & he jokes around a lot in his lectures. I skipped lectures, didn't do the readings and did reasonably well on the tests (all MC).
One of the most enjoyable and memorable profs I have ever had.  I couldn't wait to get to class most days. Made me feel like I am receiving true VALUE  FOR  THE TUITION!

He wrote the textbook for the class so his lectures are basically just going over his textbook and some articles from another textbook. His lectures are hilarious, he often gets off topic but he's really funny. Tests are multiple choice and easy if you do the reading. The paper is more tricky as the TA grades them.
Easy

His lectures are among the best lectures I've had at U of T, he successfully combined his great sense of humour and his comprehensive knowledge on linguistics.  If I had taken his course in my first year, I might choose to major in linguistics. I definitely recommend his course.

Attending lectures is not essential because most of the content is a review of his book, but he if you have the time go. He is the sweetest, most genuine professor I have ever come across at U of T. Great sense of humour and obviously loves what he does.

Danesi's class is entertaining and you can expect to be inspired by him. However, in order to pass the test, you must read the book written by him besides go to the lecture. He will often be off the topic so you have to do the reading (The TA will make the test but not him).
Amazing person, amazing lecturer, brilliant mind. Sees validity in everything - no need for disciplinary language as he's a truly clear mind and can see the crux of your argument. Brilliant educator.
Talks more about his band than the course material at hand. I probably would have passed this class without cracking open the text or attending at a single lecture.
Great course. Would recommend.
Loved him!

He is such a great prof, but his courses just aren't worth it because of the TAs. They will screw you over and claim to be proud of the fact the class got a low average on tests. Don't be fooled. First test was easy and then they got progressively harder. The essays were a mess. The TAs mark those EXTREMELY brutally. Don't take this course.

This guy is without a doubt the most humble and compassionate teacher you will meet in your life. He is simply amazing. The class however is based purely on his book so barely anyone attends lecture. I couldn't wait to go though cause he is entertaining. WARNING: THE TA'S WILL BE THE ONES TO SCREW YOU OVER. They will bell curve the essays madly!!

Very easy prof, even said he got in trouble for being too easy, so he bellcurves down at the end. He's pretty lazy and likes to talk about random things. If you're taking Anthro of Brands, you don't really have to work hard in his class to get a B (after bellcurve). But you should still go to class to have an idea of what the topics are.

He is a nice guy, but his lectures are disorganized. Hard to get an A in the class. Everyone cheats in class. Complete Chaos.. No one comes to the lectures. Bad learning experience overall. Everyone is talking nicely because he's a very nice guy. But, learning experience wise, Not a good class to take

Danesi is wonderful! You can't hate him no matter how hard you try. Everyone complains about how the TA makes the tests that hard, but honestly just study the textbooks and you'll be fine. You don't really learn anything from him, but I go to class because it's so entertaining
He's the best. He'd give everyone 100 if he could, seriously. His course saved my rough first year, haha.

I dont understand, he writes his book that we use in class but has a hard time covering it in class because he forgets what he wrote about...lectures are a waste of time. tests questions based solely on book even random sentences in the chapter that may deal with history.

Danesi is now one of my fav professors at UofT. He really cares about his students and has a easy going mentality.His laugh is funny!:p. My experience in his class was above average.He helped me understand the material(loved his book!)and also invited the class to many conferences to which I attended all.The TA is approachable,nice and intelligent.
Danesi's courses are easy.... MYTH.

Danesi’s the best. Yeah, the class grades are low but they boost them, so I’m not complaining. The TA’s nice, she responds to emails faster than any other TA I've had, but I don’t get why she writes the tests when she’s only supposed to be grading us. Read the text twice and you'll be fine. I’m sticking it through for second semester.

Danesi's probably once of the nicest professors at U of T (and one of the easiest markers) but unfortunately his TA (for this course at least) is terrible. His lectures were interesting but not mandatory - he tended to go off topic a lot. Don't take VIC112 thinking it's a bird course; maybe before UofT forced him to bring in the TA but not anymore.

Definitely not a bird course anymore. Don’t take it if you expect an A. I learned a lot, Danesi's great, the TA was nice, but definitely wanted a lot more work out of us than I thought I’d have to do going in.

Danesi's interesting and fun, but VIC112's been ruined by the bringing in of a TA. Danesi marks (unlike any other U of T prof) quite generously, and U of T has a problem with that, so now all marked portions of the class are handled by a TA. Because of this, tests have nothing to do with the lectures. Don't go in thinking it'll be a bird course.

Can't believe I am actually withdrawing from one of his courses now. He's brought in these TAs that make things way too difficult. Saddest part about it is that TAs purposefully make the material hard, I'm not sure not why or what they get for doing this. If you are taking this guy's courses do not expect an A

He is a very entertaining teacher. However, don't bother with this ANT253 course! It is no longer a bird course.  The tests were pretty good; fairly easy + a good break from science.  However, the final is worth 50 pct!!! It was graded extremely + unnecessarily harshly ... making this, in the end, not a bird course but smtg that pulls dwn your avg

Dont waste you're time with this course, the mid terms are reasonable but the final essay (worth 50%) is graded by the TA's who are too bitter about the fact that they're degree isn't worth the paper its printed on. Finished with a 76 which, from what I can tell was one of the highest grades in the course, that in itself speaks volumes.

ANT253 ended up being a total F over because of the TAs. They make the tests and mark the essays. The only benefit you get from Danesi now is light readings. Beyond that you are screwed. TAs managed to maintain a pretty low class average last semester.

I took this as a bird course and now I want an ANT minor. Danesi is an amazing lecturer! His book is clear and informative, great for a course with no prereqs. You can coast through this class, or you can actively engage and learn a lot from a really smart prof - it's up to you. Be warned, TAs do all the marking now!
He's a great guy and fair prof. His quizes were fairly simple, but the essay component was a complete downer. The easiness of this course was defintely exaggerated.

The course is now runned by TAs, it's extremely hard to even get a B+. Only the exam is ok, but the tests and essay are marked like hell. New break down - 25% 4 tests with MC, SA, 1 small essay per test - 35% for 2 essays - 1 exam 40 %. I was going into this course thinking it would be an easy A- or even A. Not true at all.

An inspirational professor. Although the class he taught was really early and it wasn't always neccessary to be present, I hated missing any of his lectures. It was a pleasure listening to his insights and accounts of knowledge. I wish to take another course of his someday.
Awesome awesome guy
unlike other prof, he understands his students are human beings and not robots.  when i grow old, i want to be like him.
he is the most amazing person i've met. unlike other prof, he understands his students are human beings and not robots. when i grow old, i want to be like him.
cool!

The prof is amazing in his delivery method of lecture material. Don't take his easy going nature and think you'd do well in his class. The 2nd and 3rd essays required a lot more thinking, rewriting, group work etc. It took the majority of the class the full 2 hrs to finish the  final test and the exam. Yet, for his teaching style I highly rec him(:

Perhaps the most amazing teacher so far in my 1st year experience. After walking out of his class you actually remember and understand things he talks about (regardless of their usefulness), unlike MAT135, BIO150, CHM138, PHY131... Danesi is the single prof at UofT that has the courage to stand up to the insanely-stupid structure of the university.
So entertaining. You wouldn't need to go to his class to do well in it, but he's so funny that I do anyway.

He's a cool guy, but I didn't learn anything. I enrolled in the class hoping to learn about youth culture, but didn't attend a single lecture after 3 weeks. The class became Danesi's personal audience for his stand-up act. I wish he could mix the jokes with some sort of course material.
he is amazing!
BEST PROF AT U OF T HANDS DOWN. this guy is beyond amazing, take his class you wont regret it!
WOOOO
I love him so much! He is the one of the best profs in U of T.
super easy to follow and understand!
he's hilarious. class is fun. exams are relatively easy if u actually do all the readings. all questions are from the txtbks.
One of the most amazing profs! Kept classes highly entertaining. Actually looked forward to attending his classes, because of his humour and relaxed teaching style. AMAZING, JUST AMAZING!

the best prof EVER!!! Truly an inspiration.  very helpfull, tries his best to help students and best of all trashes U of T all the time lol.  Easy tests, don't need to go to class just read the text.  went to class maybe 3 times andgot a 92 in both of his classes
very nice prof. learned a lot--jokes really helped
His lectures are super funny. Yet there is little information expressed in the lectures so its almost more worth your time to do the readings. The lectures are more just an added bonus.
This course is billed as being a easy/enjoyable course. The TAs make it otherwise. You have been warned.

I have a lot of respect for this man. Yes, they are bird courses. If you can't deal with that, get your head examined. Respects you as an adult; whether you learn something or not is entirely up to you. Trashes U of T which is very satisfying. U of T is a dump; as loathesome as he is wonderful. Enjoy one of his classes!
i think hes great. funny guy. and bashes u of t.
incredibly intelligent, great personality and sense of humour! One of the best profs ar U of T!
I love this prof.  I was never bored durring his 2 hour lectures and im going to take ALL HIS COURSES.
Best prof ever.  He makes school worth comming to, especially since U of T SUCKS.  I will take ALL his courses.

Single handedly responsible for tuning the semiotics program at UofTinto a joke. Made no effort to actually teach - spent each class making jokes, and pretending to fiddle with technical equipment. Never taught any semiotician's theories other than his own. Gave references out like candy but knew nothing about his students to put in them.

His course is a joke.  Goes off on many tangents.  Fortunately he's a funny guy.  But if you actually want to learn stuff (especially if you know anything about linguistics, then I'd steer clear of this class).
I LOVE DANESI...BEST PROF EVER!!!
LOVE HIM,,, he is GREATTTTTTT
his classes are ones that i actually go to AND enjoy.
I LOVE HIM!!! anything that has to do with him is awesome!!!
It's a treat to attend his lectures and he doesn't care about maintaining a particular class average, despite taking flack from the university. Probably the coolest prof at the U of T.
Excellent and Inspirational
I thought that test would be easy. but it's NOT! And each question is 50-50, so it's a risk taker.
Maybe relevant 20 years ago, not so much now.
Great professor, who gives out great marks!
danesi=amazing

A joke. You could get an A by drooling and wetting yourself. The TAs are hopeless. Expect  assignments to come back late and barely read. On the plus side, it's guaranteed to boost your GPA - unless you're in a coma. And that Superman thing...

What a joke. If you want to learn about Semiotics you have to teach yourself. A nice man but more interested in being liked than actually teaching. By treating the subject so lightly, it's a bit condescending, Bring Testa back to the Semiotics department maybe then it will get some respect.
Simply the best prof at UT

You will get out of the class what you put into it. It is easy yes, but the prof makes the material fun, and makes you want to learn more of it! He understands University is not only about being stuck-up and boring. Bravo to him! HIGHLY RECCOMEND!

This professor is the reason why the semiotics department is an absolute joke.  He's great the first time round, as in, first year.  If you're looking for serious scholarship, though, or any kind of real teaching, not recycled stories about his cat and granddaughter, this is not your man.
he's the man. ask him about his cat

Shut up, person below me, fool.  Danesi is awesome.  Lively and energetic, and funny too.  Lighthearted and enthusiastic, he's one of the kindest profs.  I wish all profs were more like Danesi, and less stuck up.
he's so nice!!!
Basically Danesi's M.O. is to write a good-but-uninspired textbook and let you study from it while he wastes lecture hours trying to get you to like him.
awesome
Very relaxed prof.  Easy and very understanding! Take ANY course with him and you'll definitely do well and enjoy it!
BEST PROF EVER!

he's awesome! he makes learning really fun and really interesting at the same time. plus the material is a lot more comprehendable and u actually engage with it. he's a great personality and that shows up in the way his students love the course! u rock professor danesi! :)

I feel like going to a stand-up commedy each time I go to his class! He knows his stuff and made me interested in semiotics so much that I decided to go for a minor in semiotics though I already had a major and a specialist!

Amazing professor..not as easy as he say he is (but those who cheat will do fine because in a class of more than 100 with no supervision, it becomes a bit unfair for those who are honest!  So, people who say Prof's danesi is easy is wrong. He's very funny and witty..a great prof overall!
Great guy, really funny.  I want to take more classes with him as the teacher.
Funny guy. His book explains everything, pretty straight forward course, i haver no problem geting a 90 by showing up for no more than 3 lecs
anyone that can keep me laughing for more than 75% of class is a joy to have as a prof.
denasi's pure jks...hahaha
I would recommend this course to any U of T St. George students... you won't regret it one bit.
No Comments

way too easy! and that is a bad thing. first year when i slpet 16 hours a day i thought this was a bonus. but now that im in third year it`s just annoying.  Why am I paying 400$ for learning absolutely nothing?  Nice man though...he IS Woody Allen.
He was so amazingly funny, and made the class a real joy to attend!
Incredibly easy which makes for a boring class.

The first time you have Danesi, you'll love him and think he's the best prof at U of T.  You'll think this as long as your first class with him is also your last class.  All his courses are exactly the same, as are his textbooks.
Easiest course I ever took, nicest prof - he handed out timbits during our exam! He obviously loves teaching.

Wonderful & enthusiastic man. Useless lectures. Stop going to class after the first day and u are still guaranteed an 85. One T/F test that everyone gets perfect on. 2 small essays and 1 JOKE exam. TAKE THIS COURSE!
Wonderful prof! This class is fantastic~ had it been just a little bit later i would have attended for lectures for sure! Humurous and enthusiastic! Best prof at UT by far!!
He is great~! the test was easy.. his lectures are interesting.. workload was very low.. u'll regret it if u don't take this course~
A wonderful person! Loves what he does!
don't take more than 1 class with this man.  it's a waste of 800 bucks because you'll get the same class (not even taught differently).   even all of his own books use the same examples.
He's very approachable, and nice.  But, he doesn't keep to his word!
What a great guy! i wish he taught all my courses. im actaully going 2 miss him.

He has many respectable problems with the system. He's been teaching forever. But he stays enthusiastic and funny as hell. Easy and clear to listen to. VERY approachable. And a free great grade in the end. A must-have prof!
he's a fun prof. and lectures better when it's not from his notes
Man....almost no need to study for his tests.  Just ask your next door neighbor when you're doing your T/F test for answers.  Also, he is the funniest prof. I had ever met.

Meh - really doesn't say much, but entertaining to watch.  Really tries to be a fun prof, but is very light on challenge and depth of thought.  His tests/exams and essays are a joke - I spent less than 10 hours TOTAL studying/writing and got a 78.
i actually wake up in the morining early enough to make it to the (middle) of his lecture.  he can always do stand up comedy if he gets tired of working? at u of t!
Danesi is the best - he is so fun!
Danesi is a born entertainer who loves his cat.  Great prof!
the best prof ive ever had

Danesi is an amazing professor. His lectures are entertaining, and he makes learning so enjoyable. I will definitely try to take other classes that he teaches. He is causing so many people to love his field of study by being so infectiously enthusiastic.
is this guy a joke? making us buy his books not because they're good, but so he makes money?
What a joke. Insulting level of instruction. Just terrible if you wanted to get something substanital out of it. I learned more on my own.

PROF. DANESI IS BY FAR ONE OF THE MOST MODEST AND MOST INFORMATIVE PROFESSORS AT U of T.  AS A NOW GRADUATE, HE DRAWS YOU INTO HIS LECTURES BY FOCUSING ON THE MOST IMPORTANT FACTS AND AVOIDS DIGRESSION ON THE SECONDARY FACTS.  IN A WORD, HE "ROCKS&qu
prof danesi kicks butt! he makes going to class FUN :) HIGHLY RECOMMENDED! i think he's one of the very best u of t has to offer!

MAKE SURE U GO TO atleast ONE OF HIS LECTURES!!!!...prolabaly one of the best teachers i have ever had...actually makes funny jokes and know what students want to hear...interesting guy, but doesnt mark any of teh work which sucks cuz the TA's mess u

They're right, the TA's mark the work, which SUCKS, but this prof himself, is amazing. He's funny, unpretentious, overall a great guy to go to. I highly recommend. Just make sure you pick a good TA like Oliver Schuster, not Paolo Chirumbolo or something.
yay!

you GOTTA love him. just attend ONE lecture of his and you'll see why. he doesn't even try to be pretentious...i don't think he even thinks himself to be any smarter than us...which is really a first for a prof!

THE CREAM OF UOFTS CRUMMY CROP!  GOD BLESS HIM honestly the best prof at u of t...THE BEST...smart...knowledgeable....GOOD HEARTED......take his course...he's absolutely amazing and he makes an early class fun to attend...YAY DANESI YOURE THE BEST !
thanks, professore, you made my year! funny, funny guy, very italian, SO nice and extremely helpful
KICKS DERRIERE!
oh my god he is the best prof i'v had so far in my two years. He's sweet, helpful and funny. i know of students who weren't taking this course were just attending it out of interest

Unfortunately, not qualified to teach Pop Culture.  Seems he was put their against his will.  A good professor when he is in his element, but embrassingly out of place when teaching a foreign discipline.

he may be easy, but he wont teach you anything. now that the TAs mark his stuff, you're screwed: hes totally unclear about expectations and the TAs mark you on stuff he hasnt taught. if you want to get a credit for nothing, take this course.
Amazing Prof, the best I've ever had. He's so nice, so approachable, makes the material interesting, incorporates slides, movies, clips. Great guy in general. Best UofT prof.

Without a doubt the best professor I've ever had.  He really enjoys what he's doing, the students enjoy being in his class, and the extracurricular activities he organises makes it even better.
very easy class... all i do is read the text and im great.. waste of lecture time, space
Simply the best!  I miss the Friday class
Funny but his schtick gets old quick and becomes alienating.  Smart yet his act makes it condescending
His easiness is just  a form of being condescending. Fools!
Amazing prof.  Very helpful.  Made me look at life differently.

AWESOME VERYFUNNY easy course, best prof @ uoft (this is well known, ask around)
very nice, funny guy

simply the best
so easy he's boring
friendly, hilarious, his textbook on Semiotics is indispensable
makes me get out of bed in the morning - he is entertaining, fun & enthusiastic!

Easiest course ever taken, and a good balance of knowledge and jokes

This guy is so funny, he looks like Woody Allen, he cracks me up.

every student at u oft should take this course!  I love him! he's the cutest!

Makes all the info memorable. I love him!

One of the nicest profs at U of T, and one of the most interesting courses too
he's getting funnier in his old age....
